result.execSummary:
The defendant Jacki L. Rickerman was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 1st Reckless Homicide/Deliver Drugs, a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.02(2)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: The Court sentences Ms. Rickerman to 20 years, with an Initial Term of Confinement in Prison of 12 years, and the maximum time to serve on Extended Supervision of  8 years.  This sentence is consecutive to any previously imposed sentence.

superMiscConds.notes:
--to pay restitution for the funeral expenses of the victim in the amount of $11,329.09, payable to Richard and Joan Carlson, joint and several with co-actor Kelly Braun

--to pay the restitution surcharge
--to pay mandatory court costs, fees, assesment and surcharges

--no possession or consumption of alcohol or illegal drugs

--no presence in bars, taverns, liquor stores

--no contact with any known drug offender except as aproved by the Agent

--no contact with Kelly Braun

--to undergo assessment, treatment, counseling as directed by the Agent

--to provide a DNA sample upon demand

Arresting Agency: WTPD

If probation, parole or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of the victim(s) and government entities for the balance due.
--to undergo AODA assessment and follow through with treatment recommendations

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jacki L. Rickerman

records.addlTxt:
[MK] case called at 8:42am. 
Defendant Jacki L. Rickerman in court, in custody, with Attorney Jeffrey J De La Rosa.  ADA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin. 
ADA Hall submits the victim impact statement.  
Sentencing arguments given by ADA Hall, by Attorney De La Rosa. 
Attorney De La Rosa reads a letter from the Defendant's parents and then the letter-statement of Ms. Rickerman.

The Court sentences Ms. Rickerman to 20 years, with an Initial Term of Confinement in Prison of 12 years, and the maximum time to serve on Extended Supervision of  8 years.  This sentence is consecutive to any previously imposed sentence. 
The Court finds that the Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program "Boot Camp".
The Court finds that the Defendant is not eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.
The Court gives 237 days credit for time already served. 

The Court orders as conditions of Extended Supervision:
--to undergo AODA assessment and follow through with treatment recommendations
--to undergo assessment, treatment, counseling as directed by the Agent
--to pay restitution for the funeral expenses of the victim in the amount of $11,329.09, payable to Richard and Joan Carlson, joint and several with co-actor Kelly Braun
--to pay the restitution surcharge 
--no possession or consumption of alcohol or illegal drugs
--no presence in bars, taverns, liquor stores
--no contact with any known drug offender except as aproved by the Agent
--no contact with Kelly Braun
--to pay mandatory court costs, fees, assesment and surcharges
--to provide a DNA sample upon demand

Explanation of Determinate Sentence form given to the Defendant
recess 10:03am
Packet of 6 character letters filed by the Defense
Copied to Attorney's on 7/1/16
Witness
of the Testimony of Kelly Braun held on May 24, 2016 before the Honorable Randy R Koschnick
Sentencing hearing on July 25, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Defendant's Exhibit #33 from the 5/25/16 Jury Trial
Court's Exhibit C from 5/25/16 Jury Trial

DAY 3 of 3:  
[MK] case called at 8:34am. 
Defendant Jacki L. Rickerman in court, in custody, with Attorney Jeffrey J De La Rosa and Attorney Whitney Hagemann.  ADA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.  
Attorney De La Rosa informs the Court that Ms. Rickerman is choosing not to testify.
Through inquiries made to Ms. Rickerman, the Court confirms with Ms. Rickerman that she is choosing not to testify.
Jury enters at 8:37am.
In response to the Court's inquiry, the Jury members verify that they complied with the Order to not conduct their own investigation. 

Captain Randall Johnson- sworn & testifies 
--the Court reads the Exhibits #6, #7, and #8 Stipulations to the Jury
--cross examination by Attorney De La Rosa
--Jury exits at 9:14am for the Defense Motion to Strike and Motion for Mistrial; during the arguments, the Motion for Mistrial is withdrawn; the Motion to Strike is overruled 
--Defendant's Exhibit #33
--redirect examination by Attorney De La Rosa 
--Juror written question (marked as Exhibit C) asked of the Witness by the Court
--follow up examiation by ADA Hall
State rests 10:00am. Defense rests 10:00am. Evidence closed 10:00am.
Recess 10:00am, reconvene 10:20 Jury enters.
The Court excuses the Jury for an extended lunch break. The Jury exits at 10:22am.
Jury Instruction Conference held (10:22am to 10:38am)  
Reconvene 1:18pm.
On Motion of ADA Hall, the Court amends the Information to modify the date of the alleged violation to be May 5 or May 6, 2014; the Court finds that this is in conformance with the evidence. 
Jury enters at 1:20pm

Closing arguments given by ADA Hall (1:21pm-1:40pm)
Closing arguments given by Attorney  (1:41pm-2:13pm)
Rebuttal Closing arguments given by ADA  (2:14pm-2:25pm)
The Court instructs the Jury (2:25pm-2:41pm)
Deputy D. Griffee is sworn as the Jury Bailiff.
The alternate jurors are selected through the tumbler system; Jurors #561 and #1117 are excused from the Jury. 
The Jury retires to deliberate at 2:43pm.
After a discussion between the Court and counsel, the Court directs the clerk to provide all received exhibits to the Jury for use in deliberations.
Recess 2:45pm [The clerk provides, through the Jury Bailiff, Exhibits #9 through #28, #30, #31, #32 to the Jury. Exhibits not being provided are:  #2, #29, #33.] 

6:40pm.: Jury returns with its Verdict.

The Jury finds Ms. Rickerman guilty of First Degree Reckless Homicide. 
The Court excuses the Jury. The Jury exits at 6:42pm.
ADA Hall Motions for Judgment to be entered on the Verdict.
Attorney La Rosa Motions to Set Aside the Verdict.
The Court denies the Motion to Set Aside the Verdict.
The Court receives the Verdict, finds Ms. Rickerman guilty and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.
The Court revokes Bond.  Ms. Rickerman is to be held without bail pending sentencing. 
On Motion of the State, the Court orders a Pre-Sentence Investigation, requiring the Probation Office to file the PSI Report by July 11th.
recess 6:45pm. 

NEXT:  (1) clerk is to prepare PSI Order  (2) Sentencing Hearing on July 25th at 8:30am (allow two hours)- send notices

DAY 2 of 3:  
[MK] case called at 8:35am. 
Defendant Jacki L. Rickerman in court, in custody, with Attorney Jeffrey J De La Rosa and Attorney Whitney Hagemann.  ADA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.  
After ADA Hall raises a concern regarding the references made by the Defense to having Matt Reineke testify including about his recent criminal conviction, the Court indicates it will address this concern later in the day. Attorney De La Rosa gives arguments in support of his Motion for Reconsideration of the Court's ruling on the immunity information being presented to the Jury during Kelly Braun's continued testimony. 
The Court confirms its ruling that immunity being granted in this trial is irrelevant, as far as the Jury is concerned.  Neither party will inquire into the immunity question.  
Attorney De La Rosa alerts the Court and ADA Hall that he intends to elicit testimony from Kelly Braun that Mr. Braun testified under oath in an Extended Revocation Hearing, and during hearing he had lied regarding some information that has come into this case. 
Jury enters at 8:54am.
In response to the Court's inquiry, the Jury members verify that they complied with the Order to not conduct their own investigation. 

Kelly Braun- sworn and testifies
[Clerk's added note:  Counsel for Mr. Braun, Attorney Steven Luchsinger, has been present in the courtroom from 8:35am and throughout this testimony.]
--cross examination by Attorney De La Rosa
--redirect examination by ADA Hall
--recess 10:09am, reconvene 10:26am
--further redirect examination by ADA Hall
--recross examination by Attorney De La Rosa
[Attorney Luchsinger exits the courtroom at 10:36am.]

Dr. Wieslawa Tlomak- sworn & testifies
--stipulation Exhibits #3, #5 are read by the Court to the Jury 
--direct examination by ADA Hall    

Vickie L. Timm- sworn & testifies
--direct examination by ADA Hall

Carl Braun- sworn & testifies
--direct examination by ADA Hall 
--cross examination by Attorney De La Rosa

Christopher Vesper- sworn & testifies
--direct examination by ADA Hall
--cross examination by Attorney De La Rosa 
--redirect examination by ADA Hall 
--recross examination by Attorney De La Rosa

Officer Jacob Reitz- sworn & testifies
--direct examination by ADA Hall
--cross examination by Attorney De La Rosa
Jury exits at 11:44am
The Court addresses the Defense Daubert-challenge to the State's intended testimony from Det. Sgt Gray.  After hearing arguments, the Court will allow Det. Sgt. Gray to testify regarding the typical prices for a bindle of  heroin in Jefferson County a bindle; approximately how much a typical bindle is; how much a typical user uses; how much a typical user would get for $100; what Det. Sgt Gray has personally observed about the signs and symptoms of withdrawal.  The Court will not allow Det. Sgt Gray to testify about how long after last-use withdrawal would typically set in.   
recess 12:00pm, reconvene 1:23pm. Jury enters.

Martin G Koch- sworn & testifies
--direct examination by ADA Hall
--State's Exhibit #17, #18 

Janelle Cacopardo- sworn & testifies
--direct examination by ADA Hall
--State's Exhibit #19, #20, #21, #21A, #22, #22A, #23, #23A, #24, #24A, #25, #25A, #26, #26A, #27 
--recess 2:10pm
--recess 2:35pm; the Jury enters 
--cross examination by Attorney De La Rosa 

Det. Sgt. Margareta Gray- sworn & testifies
--direct examination by ADA Hall
--cross examination by Attorney De La Rosa
--a written juror question (marked as Exhibit B) is asked of the Witness by the Court 
--follow up examination by ADA Hall

Captain Randall Johnson- sworn & testifies
--direct examination by ADA Hall 
--State's Exh. #28, #29
--stipulation Exhibit #1 is read by the Court to the Jury 
--State's #30, #30A, #31, #31A, #32, #32A
--Jury exits 3:49pm, reconvene4:10pm Jury enters.
--continuation of direct examination by ADA Hall
--direct examination is completed; the Court excuses the Jury for the day     
--Jury exits at 4:16pm.
The Court and counsel discuss scheduling.
The Court reviews with Ms. Rickerman her right to testify/not to testify. 
recess 4:20pm.

DAY 1 of 3:  
[MK] case called at 8:39am. 
Defendant Jacki L. Rickerman in court, in custody, with Attorney Jeffrey J De La Rosa and Attorney Whitney Hagemann.  ADA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.  
The Court addresses procedural matters related to trial: 
--ADA Hall indicates that she has arranged for Kelly Braun to appear now, to be sworn and then assert his 5th Amendment Right to not testify.  While he has already been convicted, there is an active appeal.  The State intends to grant immunity to Mr. Braun in regard to his testimony.
--After a discussion with counsel, the Court concludes that Mr. Braun is properly considered to be represented by counsel at this point; Mr. Braun needs to have counsel present before being called to testify. 
--The Court grants the Defendant's newly filed Motion in Limine including that the Court orders witness exclusion.  The Witness Exclusion Order shall take effect once the Jury is sworn; the State's Court Officer, Captain Randall Johnson, is excepted from the Witness Exclusion Order.
Recess 8:49am, Reconvene 9:13am with potential jurors in the courtroom.
Jury Selection:
--oath given to the array of jurors
--Voir dire by the Court
--Voir dire by ADA Hall
--Voir dire by Attorney De La Rosa; Juror # 987 is excused for cause  
--During the peremptory challenge process Juror #173 is excused for cause
Juror selected and sworn: (1) Juror #1268, (2) Juror #290, (3) Juror #2432, (4) Juror #95, (5) Juror #251, (6) Juror #933, (7) Juror #2004, (8) Juror #1971, (9) Juror #2417, (10) Juror #1276, (11) Juror #1644, 
(12) Juror #561, (13) Juror #1117, (14) Juror #211. 
The Court gives preliminary instructions to the Jury. 
Recess 10:51am, reconvene 11:12am; Jury enters. 
Opening Statements given by ADA Hall, by Attorney De La Rosa.
Jury exits at 11:27am.
Attorney De La Rosa confirms that the PD Office is appointing Attorney Luchsinger to appear with Mr. Braun today on the 5th Amendement issues as a Special Proceedings Appointment. 
The parties submit eight written Trial Stipulations which are marked as Exhibits #1 through #8.
After verifying with Ms. Ricerkman individually, that he understands and joins in these stipulations, the Court receives the Stipulations -Exhibits #1 through #8. 
Attorney De La Rosa raises a correction, that upon review of the conviction information, he believes Kelly Braun has 23 prior convictions instead of 20.  On agreement of counsel, the Court modifies its previous ruling on prior convictions as to Kelly Braun: Mr. Braun has 23 prior convictions for impeachment purposes.
Recess 11:40am. reconvene 1:20pm

Zachary Robert Filenius- sworn & testifies
--direct examination by ADA Hall
--cross examination by Attorney De La Rosa 
--redirect examination by ADA Hall
--recross examination by Attorney De La Rosa

Traci Glander- sworn & testifies
--direct examination by ADA Hall
--cross examination by Attorney De La Rosa 
--direct examination by ADA Hall
--recross examination by Attorney De La Rosa
--re-redirect examination by ADA Hall

Tyler Peterson- sworn & testifies
--direct examination by ADA Hall 
--cross examination by Attorney De La Rosa
--redirect examination by ADA Hall

Bruce Hady- sworn & testifies
--direct examination by ADA Hall
--cross examination by Attorney De La Rosa 
--direct examination by ADA Hall
--recross examination by Attorney De La Rosa

Jury exits at 2:26pm; scheduling is discussed.
Recess 2:28pm, reconvene 2:43pm.
The Court clarifies its ruling on the Other Acts Motion regarding Ms. Rickerman's possession of heroin on a previous date.
Jury enters at 2:50pm. 

Officer Laura Bohlman- sworn & testifies
--direct examination by ADA Hall
--Juror written question (marked as Court's Exhibit A) is asked of the witness by the Court

Det. Michael Beisbier- sworn & testifies
--direct examination by ADA Hall
--State's Exh. #9, #10, #11, #12
--cross examination by Attorney De La Rosa

Sgt. David Brower- sworn & testifies 
--direct examination by ADA Hall 
--State's Exh. #13, #13-A, #14
--cross examination by Attorney De La Rosa
Jury exits at 3:45pm. 

Attorney Steven Luchsinger is now present in the courtroom gallery as counsel for Witness Kelly Braun.  
The Court hears arguments on the State's position that there should be no information given to the Jury regardmor any reference to the State's request for immunity.  The Court finds that immunity is not relevant as it pertains to this Jury because Mr. Braun is in no better or worse position legally today if he either is not required to testify or if he testifies he is given immunity;  the Court will not allow reference in front of the Jury by either party to the immunity that is being granted today.  

Kelly Braun (in custody)- sworn & testifies (outside the presence of the Jury) 
--the Court informs Mr. Braun of the State's intent to ask the Court to grant immunity for the statemenst that he makes today in court; further- 
--on Motion of the State, the Court motions for the Court to grant immunity;  the State would not use his statements given in court today in any future court hearing aginst him in ;  unless the State would still be allowed to pursue permury charges if the State oes believe he has testified untruthfully
--the Court grants the State's Motion .  The Court orders Mr. Braun to answer questions put to him today in this trial and also the Court orders that he be given immunity from anything
Jury enters at 4:09pm

Kelly Braun (in custody)- sworn & testifies (in the presence of the Jury) 
--direct examination by ADA Hall
--State's Exhibit #15, #16
--the Stipulation marked as Exhibit #4 is read to the Jury by the Court  
--State's Exhibit #4-A
--the testimony of Mr. Braun is interrupted due to the time of day and the anticipation that Defense examination will be lengthy
Jury exits at 4:44pm.
The Court and counsel discuss scheduling.
recess 4:48pm.
Proposed Order to Produce
to Produce and Transport the Defendant from Dodge Correctional from May 23, 2016 -May 26, 2016

[FSSC and State's Pretrial Motions]

Case called at 8:41am [mo]
Defendant Jacki L. Rickerman in court, in custody with Attorney Jeffrey Jacob De La Rosa.   ADA Monica Hall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.


Upon inquiry of the Court, parties indicate that they are prepared to proceed to trial.
The Court informs parties that it has numerous cases scheduled for trial next week, reminds Ms. Rickerman that today is her last opportunity to enter a plea.
The Court allows until 3:00pm today to exhaust all options of resolution

The Court and Counsel discuss procedural matters of Trial:
--the Court directs counsel to be available next Friday to allow additional time for trial
--the Court will enter a final decision on the start day of the trial by noon tomorrow, whether begins on Monday or Tueday
--2 alternate jurors; 14 total jurors
--5 strikes
--jurors are allowed to take notes
--jurors are allow to ask questions
--no Miranda/Goodchild issues

On State's Motion to Impeach Defendant with Priors:
--argument given by Atty. De La Rosa
--The Court finds that Ms. Rickerman has 4 prior convictions for purposes of trial

On Prior Convictions of State's Witnesses:
--The Court grants the Defense motion to the State's Witnesses with prior convictions as stated on record today
--K.B.=20
--C.B.=1
--B.H.= 4
--Z.F.= 29
--T.G.=1
--C.V.=2

recess: 9:04am
from Attorney De La Rosa enclosing additional Discovery

[MK] case called at 11:56am.
Defendant Jacki L. Rickerman in court, in custody, with Attorney Jeffrey J De La Rosa.  ADA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.
On the State's 4/21/16 Notice of Motion and Motion to Allow Production and Admission of Other Crimes, Wrongs, or Acts of Evidence:
----Attorney De La Rosa objects to all three of the State's proposed Other Acts-evidence.
----the Court grants the Motion as to the first proposed Other Act involving the crime charged in #15CF156 to prove the Defendant has access to heroin, that she knows what heroin is, and that she kept it in her bra. The Court detemines that it is being offered for proper purposes.  The Court will give a cautionary instruction upon request of either party.
--the Court excludes the second proposed Other Act involving T.K. who would testify that he would transport J.N. and he observed transactions between J.N. and the Defendant.  The Court will give this ruling reconsideration if that State can provide evidence that the events occurred as alleged and what T.N. can say he actually observed.   
--the Court grants the Motion as to the third proposed Other Act involving C.V. testifying that the Defendant hand-delivered heroin to him as he gave her money. This is admissible for the purposes of opportunity, intent and knowldge. The Court clarifies that the Escalade truck information is not part of the prior bad act. The Court will give a cautionary instruction upon request of either party.

On Ms. Rickerman's 4/26/16 letter-Motion for Bail Reduction: 
--arguments given by ADA Hall
--the Court denies the Motion; the Court continues the previously ordered cash bail requirement
Attorney De La Rosa indicates that he will be filing a Motion In Limine.
The Court reviews with Ms. Rickerman that the FSSC will be the deadline for entering a change-of-plea or resolving the case without trial. 
recess 12:20pm.  

NEXT:  the 5/17/16 FSSC and the 5/23/16 Jury Trial commencement remain on the Court's calendar

Case called at 10:07 am [Clerk SH]
Defendant Jacki L. Rickerman in court, in-custody, with Attorney Jeffrey Jacob De La Rosa. ADA Theresa A Beck appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty De La Rosa submits letter; confirms for the Court that this is new letter - copies provided to Counsel
Arguments presented

The Court presents basis, amends bond and requires a $7,500 CASH bond, with conditions:
--No Contact with Kelly Braun 
--No Contact with Carl Braun
--no possession or consumption of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription
--take all prescription medications as prescribed
--no presence in bars, taverns, liquor stores
--Ms. Rickerman is to report to the Jefferson County Jail for drug screening every 48 hours
--The Court imposes a curfew on Ms. Rickerman she is to be at her residence between the hours of 9:00pm and 6:00am 
Atty De La Rosa informs the Court that he has not received any pre-trial motions from the State as of yet, but does anticipate motions in limine
ADA Beck informs the Court that she aniticipates ADA Hall filing motions in limine and some pre-trial motions
Court requests that Counsel get together next week to discuss filing of motions and to contact the Court's JA regarding the scheduling of those motions due to the volume of upcoming homicide trials coming up. Court indicates that It will not set any specific guidelines for Counsel at this time.
Recess: 10:23 am

NEXT: (1) Case to remain as scheduled

Set for Bail Review
Bail/bond hearing on April 1, 2016 at 10:00 am.

Case called at 9:42 am [Clerk SH]
Defendant Jacki L. Rickerman in court, in-custody, with Attorney Jeffrey Jacob De La Rosa. ADA Monica J. Hall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty De La Rosa informs the Court that they do not have resolution, and do not believe settlement will be reached. Requests matter be set for trial
ADA Hall informs the Court 2 days will be needed for trial and that the State could be ready for trial in about 30 days
Atty De La Rosa requests that matter be set for 3- 4 days in about 90 days
Court informs parties that all motions needing more than 15 minutes must be filed and heard prior to FSSC
ADA Hall informs the Court that the State does intend to file an other acts motion
Court orders that all motions that will take longer than 15 minutes, shall be filed by March 28th - both parties
Atty De La Rosa informs the Court that 5/17/16 is the 2nd day of a trial on BrIII and he will request that Court for a later start time to accommodate the FSSC in this matter
Court continues bond
